alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 28 at 9:10PM CDT until July 28 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Whiteside County in northwestern Illinois... South central Carroll County in northwestern Illinois... Southeastern Jackson County in east central Iowa... Northeastern Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 945 PM CDT. * At 910 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing a tornado were located along a line extending from Van Buren to Elvira, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * These dangerous storms will be near... Camanche around 915 PM CDT. Savanna, Albany, Sabula, Andover, South Sabula Lake Park, Camp Miss-Elk-Ton, Teeds Grove and Bulgers Hollow around 920 PM CDT. Clinton, Fulton, Garden Plain, East Clinton and Thomson around 925 PM CDT. Wacker, Center Hill and Thomson Causeway around 930 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these tornadic storms include Morrison, Argo Fay, Union Grove, Ustick, Fenton, Unionville, Whiteside County Fairgrounds, Ideal, Morrison-Rockwood State Park, Fairhaven, Hamilton Corners, Franklin Corners and Lyndon. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
